org.nocrala.tools.gis.data.esri.shapefile
Class ValidationPreferences

java.lang.Object
  org.nocrala.tools.gis.data.esri.shapefile.ValidationPreferences

public class ValidationPreferences
extends java.lang.Object

This class allows the client to relax the level of validation when reading a shape file. When instantiated, all validations are turned on by default, so the client can specifically turn off the required ones.

 void setAllowBadContentLength(boolean allowBadContentLength)
          Inhibits the validation of the content length of each shape.
 void setAllowBadRecordNumbers(boolean allowBadRecordNumbers)
          Inhibits the validation of the record numbers; a correct shape file must have sequential record numbers, starting at 1.
 void setAllowMultipleShapeTypes(boolean allowMultipleShapeTypes)
          Allows shapes of multiple types in the file; in a correct shape file all shapes must be of a single type, specified on the header of the file.

getForcePartType

public PartType getForcePartType()

setForcePartType

public void setForcePartType(PartType forcePartType)
Forces the part types to a specific type, disabling its validation. Set this value to null to enable the validation. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
forcePartType -

getForceShapeType

public ShapeType getForceShapeType()

setForceShapeType

public void setForceShapeType(ShapeType forceShapeType)
Forces the shape type to a specific type, disabling its validation. Set this value to null to enable the validation. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
forceShapeType -

isAllowBadRecordNumbers

public boolean isAllowBadRecordNumbers()

setAllowBadRecordNumbers

public void setAllowBadRecordNumbers(boolean allowBadRecordNumbers)
Inhibits the validation of the record numbers; a correct shape file must have sequential record numbers, starting at 1. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
allowBadRecordNumbers -

isAllowMultipleShapeTypes

public boolean isAllowMultipleShapeTypes()

setAllowMultipleShapeTypes

public void setAllowMultipleShapeTypes(boolean allowMultipleShapeTypes)
Allows shapes of multiple types in the file; in a correct shape file all shapes must be of a single type, specified on the header of the file. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
allowMultipleShapeTypes -

Inhibits the validation of the content length of each shape. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
allowBadContentLength -

isAllowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape

public boolean isAllowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape()

setAllowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape

public void setAllowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape(boolean allowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape)
Allows any (positive) number of points per shape. It's strongly advised to always limit the number of points per shape; otherwise, a corrupt file with a gigantic (garbage) number of points may crash the reader with an OutOfMemory error. Defaults to false, with a default limit of 10000.

Parameters:
allowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape -

getMaxNumberOfPointsPerShape

public int getMaxNumberOfPointsPerShape()

setMaxNumberOfPointsPerShape

public void setMaxNumberOfPointsPerShape(int maxItems)
Specifies the maximum number of points a shape can have. If a shape is found with a larger number of points a exception is thrown showing the number of points it has. This parameter can be adjusted for different files, or turned off with the method setAllowUnlimitedNumberOfPointsPerShape(). Defaults to 10000.

Parameters:
maxItems -
